Can China be held responsible for the global pandemic?  To sue the regime in an international court is nearly impossible, but there might be a way forward.  Our correspondent David Vives spoke to a civil liberties lawyer.

Guillaume Peltier said that China and WHO should be held responsible for the crisis.  He calls for the creation of an international health court on the model of the International Criminal Court created in The Hague in 1998.

But is it possible to bring China to international court?  According to French lawyer Pierre Farge, no state can take legal action against another state or nation.  It's an issue of sovereignty.  In other words, the U.S.  can't force China to accept any lawsuit.
Here's an example.  After 9-11, some states in the USA filed a suit against Saudi Arabia, and it's still going on.  On first instance, this suit has been rejected because of this sovereignty issue.
